The Barkeep told me your bosses had some assignment for me.

Yeah, he told us about you. But before we let you in, I need to familiarize you with our rules. Now, listen, our rules are simple. First rule, no shooting on our property. For two offenses, our patrol will fire on you. Even if you make a run for it, you won't be on our property again, the guards will take care of you. If you behave calmly, you won't have any problems!
I see. Is that all?
Yes, that's enough. You can go now.
Okay. Is that all?

Yes, that's enough. If you ever want to try and join the Duty Group, you're welcome to join. We need good fighters. But I must warn you, before you're accepted, you'll have to do some dangerous tasks. We don't want any weaklings, so everyone will be tested.
Stop! No one goes into Duty's base! Strangers have no business there!
What are you standing there for? Hurry up and go through!
Come on, brother. And remember, Duty's mission is purification!
Halt! You're in Duty's territory. You shoot here if you want to live... if you disobey, you'll get a bullet.
Why don't you let me into the bunker?
What do you want? Come on in.
What are you standing there for? Hurry up and get in!
Come on in, brother. And remember, Duty's mission is to purify!
What do you want?
Yes, sir.
Hello, Brother.
I'm ready to take the oath!
Well done! Then repeat after me: I, swear to defend the aims and ideals of Duty.
I swear to defend the aims and ideals of Duty!
To preserve the Earth from the dangers of the Zone. To pursue and destroy any manifestation of the Zone both within and beyond its borders!
Protect the Earth from the dangers of the Zone. Pursue and destroy any manifestations of the Zone both within and beyond its borders!
To fight against any dissent in the person of both individual stalkers and groups!
To fight any dissent in the person of both individual stalkers and factions!
And give your life in the name of justice and order on Earth!
And to give their lives in the name of justice and order on Earth!
Congratulations! You are now a full member of the Duty faction.
Go ahead.
What brings you to me, brother?
Well, if you find it, come back!

What? The one in the bar, you said? I thought he's not himself lately, and he's drunk all the time. No, we're not going to put up with this. He'll get what's coming to him. Good for you for telling me. Later, if this information checks out, you can expect a reward from the merchant.
Duty story.
Hello, stalker. Join Duty, we need good fighters. I just joined up myself. Look at the nice uniform they gave me!
Hi. It's good to have you with us. Duty's gonna need good fighters soon.
Hello, brother stalker.
Tell me about Duty.

We've been here since the beginning. The group was founded by survivors of one of the special forces sent to the Zone to deal with the cause of its emergence. We got into some serious trouble. After half the squad was killed in horrible circumstances, the survivors swore that they would not leave until they dealt with what happened in the Zone. Until they'd dealt with it!
Tell me about Freedom.

They're scumbags who don't realize the Zone is a pestilence on the Earth. They want to spread it around the world, a piece of it in every home. And they'll do anything to get it. I can't wait to get rid of them!
You want to deal with the Zone?
Yes, and we're working very hard to do just that! Our cleansing missions are burning out entire nests of mutated contagion on the approaches to the center of the Zone.
Thank you.
Hello, brother. What brings you to me?
What do you want?
Come in, don't be long. What are you staring at?
Oh, hello, old man! Glad the mutants haven't eaten you yet!
Guarding me?
Yeah, we are. guarding. So any assholes who get past the first barrier at the dump don't go any further. You wanted something?
I wanted to know something.
What's that?
Can you tell me about this place?

Before the accident in 1986, it was a workers' camp from the Rostok plant. Now, as you can see, all that's left are empty houses. Near the store in the basement you'll find a bar, stalkers from all over the Zone gather there, a local merchant works as a Barkeep, maintains the premises, so to speak. Go there if you want to trade, socialize or get an interesting assignment, you'll also get the latest news. On the corner to the north is the base of the Duty faction. If you want to try to join Duty, you can go there, they will tell you who to contact. This whole area is under Duty's protection, so be careful, don't wave your gun around, and if you shoot, our patrol will calm you down in no time.
You said there was a bar. Can you tell me where it is?
In the basement of a former department store.
Thanks for the info.
You said there's a Duty group base here. Can you tell me how to get there?
Go north, you'll see the former store building...
Thank you for the information.

Our goal, our mission, is to keep them out of here... it's just not natural for the dead to walk among the living... the law of nature... you know? Now, we're gonna collect all this dead scum and take them to the nearest gravity feeder, a good disposal facility.
Next to the bar, I think. I don't remember exactly, sorry.
Thanks for the info.
Thanks for the information.
That's crazy. What is it? in my head. I don't get it at all.
Yes... and to think, it's, uh.
The head. it's a load of bullshit. total bullshit!
No... I don't want this with me. this.
No, it's not gonna happen to me! It's not gonna happen to me!
I'm normal! I'm normal. I can take it, I can take it.
I can do it!
Good luck to you.
Hey!
I can do it. I don't want this with me. this.
Do you hear me?!
No, it's not gonna happen to me! It's not gonna happen to me!
Talk to me!
My head. this is bullshit. it's bullshit!
Shit! This is a waste of time. I need a first aid kit.
This is bullshit, what's that... in my head. I don't understand it at all!
Get the first aid kit! This should help a little.
No first aid kit. I'll have to ask the Barkeep.
Get the first aid kit! That should help a little.
I'm seeing double.
It must have helped. What do you know about the antenna on Radar? When does the radiation fade?
The radiation. radiation.
Stalker. We went to Radar together, as a group.
Well? Speak, don't be silent.
We were in a group. He's here in this bar. Talk to him. He's got a silenced rifle.
Here in the bar? I'll be right there, wait a little while.
He said you were able to get information about the radiation.
Yes... I did. It was worth a lot, and it wasn't entirely accurate.
Tell me everything you know.

I don't remember much. The radiation seems to weaken at night, sometimes by an hour, sometimes even longer... On Radar, we decided to take a shortcut, we went through an irradiated forest. As it turned out, it's no safer there... There is a hole in the fence, you can bypass some monolith patrols... No. don't-- don't--
What?
I don't remember. There's a voice calling me. I have to go.
What are you babbling about?!

I was there! I saw it! It got inside my brain and spoke to me. It spoke to me! There was a horrible voice in my head, burning my brain. The horror. The horror. The horror! Don't go in there! It will become you just like it became me. A terrible pain in my head. And a voice Whispering to me.
Calm down, buddy. It's alright, you're safe now!

Whispering. The whispering and creaking of a child's swing. My daughter. I want to see her so badly, but I can't appear in front of her. It's in my head and I'm a monster now. No, you can't. Buddy, give the Barkeep my artifact. It's all I found in there when it got inside my head. The Barkeep will give it to my wife, my daughter. It'll compensate them.
Compensate for what?

Yeah. What's going on? So you helped him. Well, good for you. I'll tell you something in confidence. We're in business together. We're making orders for the Big Land - jars of jelly. I don't know if you've seen it, but you can create your own anomaly. Talk to him, you can tell him for me.

I don't know what its name is, so here you go. Yeah, about the next task. We also need two magnets, but in addition, we need an electric ball. Here's a description of it. I'll give you all the details when you get the samples.

Uh, huh. Yeah. Let's just say there's no reward for you this time, unfortunately, but this experiment was a major step forward for us. Which means that with the next study, you'll have something special waiting for you. Now, come back in 12 hours, we need to do some calculations and analysis of your work.

To a certain extent. You see, to complete the experiment, we need a strong electromagnetic pulse. Something like a lightning strike. our generator is running out of power. We don't have time to wait for real lightning, so what we need from you is this. You need to find an Elektra-type anomaly and drop this into it. If everything goes right, the artifact will be charged.
